instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats for as long as it is connected. 

This machine was liquid damaged and taken somewhere else were all they did was a ultrasonic run.

U 7100 was corroded a bit so I replaced it, but same thing still.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: PPbus is 12.96 when the fan first starts to spin, pp3v42_g3h is a 3.42v steady even when the fan stops for a second.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
12.96V w/ or w/o battery?

Check which big coils get voltage (or pulse at least) in the 2s.

First try starting in SMC bypass mode.
Next try complete NEW BIOS file; do NOT clean ME from original.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: If 12.96 on just the charger, that is a little high. Might be worth replacing Q7130 and Q7155 with the ISL6259 at the same time to see if any change. Also check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL6259 first.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] 12.96 no battery, SMC bypass board stays on, will try new BIOS soon

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: [USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] Thanks for the tip, after checking diode mode on pins 17/18 and 27/28 pin 17 was 0.610 and not 0.140, the problem was pin 3 of R7150, to do it right I replaced R7150 after cleaning the pads well. Muchas gracias!

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Working now?

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Yes working now, but I have a new issue, the battery charges really really slow, coconut battery is telling me that it is charing with 4watts, back to troubleshooting

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Try known good battery. Could be bad battery. Also do an SMC reset.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Known good battery and 2 SMC resets, same problem, could it be something I repaired/broke?

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: I will look for a video how to troubleshoot slow charging issued and see if I learn something.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: What is now the exact value (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 of ILS6259?

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
17 0.135ohms red on gnd
18 0.133ohms red on gnd
Between the 2 pins 0.004ohms

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
I doubt you can measure 0.004 ohm (4 miliohm).
I suppose to be 4 ohm, which is OK.
In case 0.004 is diode mode reading, that could be wrong; aprox 8 ohm real value.
Some DMMs shows half value than ohm scale in diode mode!

Post PPBUS voltage and battery percentage reported by OSX.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: I have to revive this post as this MacBook is charging super slow, I check what U7100 area and R7150 where I did some work but all looks well, how do I make sure sure the battery is receiving enough/proper  current?

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Try to reply the questions...

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
Yes that will be a good start.

PPBUS is 12.58v, Battery is 12%, it does charge but super slow, same with new battery and SMC resets.

[COLOR=#007000]V[LEFT][FONT=inherit]alue (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 of ILS6259 is 3.9ohms[/FONT][/LEFT][/COLOR]

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Post Q7155 voltages with charger and battery, both connected.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
Looks like battery issue then.
Try known good one, even older; new chinese batteries are crappies.
Q7155 is ON and allows battery charging.

However, post SMC_DCIN/BMON_ISENSE levels.
ALso try PRAM reset.

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message:
This board is doing the same with known good battery and 2 other ones, pretty sure its not the battery. 

SMC_DCIN_ISENSE 0.2v
SMC_BMON_ISENSE 0.049v

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: Then try other SMC...

threads.title: 820-3476 fan spins for about 2 seconds then stops and repeats
threads.message: New SMC did not fixed it, I started a new thread since this is an issue that may not be so common [url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/53342-820-3476-charging-but-very-slow[/url]
